name: rhipsalis-baccifera
country-or-region-of-origin: Central and South America, Africa, Madagascar
distribution: Native to many tropical and subtropical countries in Central America
light: Deep shade (Less than 2 hours to no direct sunlight)
Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
fruit-description: The fruits or white, pink, or red round berries that measure about 0.3 inches in diameter.
flower-description: The flowers are small, funnel-shaped, solitary, white to greenish-white, and are produced along the stems. They bloom in the winter and spring.
stem-description: The stems are pale green to green, slender, trailing, and cylindrical. They are less than 0.2 inches in diameter. Young stems have bristled wooly areoles. As the stem matures, it becomes smooth.
